title: How to Curb the Use of Plastics in Day to Day Life

steps.headline: Avoid using plastic bags.
steps.description: While shopping or carrying your belongings, use jute bags or eco-friendly bags instead of plastic ones. If you already have a lot of plastic bags, re use them.

steps.headline: Avoid cold drinks.
steps.description: Most drinks are packaged in plastic bottles. Buy drinks or soda that are packaged in glass bottles or aluminium canisters only.

steps.headline: Avoid buying plastic furniture.
steps.description: They're cheap prices and low maintenance make it hard to resist. Instead, you can buy tyre-furniture that are very trendy, environmentally friendly, and cost effective.

methods.name: Knowing the types of Plastics and Recycle them

steps.headline: PETE Plastics
steps.description: Polyethylene terephthalate (PETE) plastics used in soda and water bottles, polybags, medicine containers, and other common consumer product containers are easiest and the most common plastics to recycle. Once recycled, PETE plastics can be used as fibrefill in winter coats, sleeping bags, and life jackets. They can also be used to make bean bags, rope, car bumpers, tennis ball felt, combs, cassette tapes, sails for boats, furniture, and of course other plastic bottles. When you buy a PETE plastic packed article you can sell it after use to the government or private recycling centres, like selling a plastic bottle with labels on it will help the environment and earn money at the same time.

steps.headline: HDPE Plastics
steps.description: HDPE or High Density Polyethylene plastics are used in heavier containers that hold Mobil, refined oil, milk, etc. They are hugely acceptable at recycling centres and are recycled into pipes, toys, plastic lumber, etc.

steps.headline: Plastics numbered 3 or above are hard to recycle and acceptable at very few recycling centres.
steps.description: These plastics include sandwich bags, baby bottle nipples, medical tubing, etc.

steps.headline: Recycling common items.

methods.name: Recycling or Reusing plastics at home

steps.headline: You can use modified plastic containers as dustbins or plant pots and other creative ideas.
Plastic rubbish can be used as foot covers for various metallic or wooden furniture as they are corrosion proof.
Plastic Bottle caps are not acceptable in many recycling centres so one way to use it is using it in craft works.
